intro: Spironema, commonly known as the spiral moss, is a genus of mosses belonging to the family Dicranaceae. These plants are characterized by their spiral arrangement of the leaf cells, which gives them their name. Spironema species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. They have a delicate, low-growing structure with small, overlapping leaves. The genus is known for its ecological importance in soil stabilization and moisture retention in humid habitats.
